alert.note: Alert for Inland Southern Brevard; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Brevard and northeastern Osceola Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 400 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Holopaw, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Brevard and northeastern Osceola Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
